hero.headline: Anthropic's Bun Acquisition Bears Fruit: Claude Code $1B Milestone Reshapes AI Coding Landscape
hero.summary: Just weeks after acquiring Bun, Anthropic confirmed Claude Code has reached $1 billion in annualized run-rate revenue—achieving this milestone in only six months since public launch. The acquisition signals Anthropic's aggressive push into developer infrastructure, combining the world's fastest JavaScript runtime with the leading agentic coding assistant.
hero.whyItMatters: This is the fastest revenue ramp in AI tooling history. With Bun's runtime capabilities now under Anthropic's roof, expect deeper integrations: faster package installations, native AI-aware tooling, and performance optimizations that could fundamentally change how Claude Code operates. The $1B milestone also validates the 'agentic coding' category as a major revenue driver.

topStories.title: Using LLMs at Oxide: A Production Engineering Perspective
topStories.summary: Oxide Computer Company published their internal RFC on how they're implementing LLMs in production systems. The document provides a rare, transparent look at enterprise LLM adoption—covering model selection, prompt engineering patterns, and security considerations from a hardware-focused company.

topStories.title: Building a Modern C64 Assembly AI Toolchain Using Gemini 3
topStories.summary: A developer created an AI-assisted toolchain for Commodore 64 assembly programming using Google's Gemini 3 Pro. The project demonstrates how modern frontier AI models can breathe new life into retro computing development with syntax highlighting, code completion, and intelligent debugging.

topStories.title: DeepLearning.AI Launches Free Claude Code Course with Anthropic
topStories.summary: DeepLearning.AI partnered with Anthropic to release a comprehensive free course on Claude Code best practices. Taught by Anthropic's Elie Schoppik, it covers building RAG chatbots, GitHub integration, plan mode, thinking modes, and memory management—essential knowledge for AI-assisted development.

topStories.title: mcp-use: Build AI Agents with MCP Servers in 6 Lines of Code
topStories.summary: A new framework simplifies building AI agents with Model Context Protocol servers. With support for both Python and TypeScript, mcp-use lets developers connect any LLM to any MCP server, create multi-step reasoning agents, and manage tool calls with minimal boilerplate.

trendingRepos.name: microsoft/VibeVoice
trendingRepos.description: Microsoft's open-source frontier voice AI for building conversational applications. Features natural speech synthesis, recognition, and real-time voice interactions—positioning as an open alternative to proprietary voice AI.

trendingRepos.name: sinelaw/fresh
trendingRepos.description: Text editor for your terminal: easy, powerful and fast. A modern Rust-based alternative for developers wanting vim-like efficiency without the steep learning curve.

trendingRepos.name: patchy631/ai-engineering-hub
trendingRepos.description: In-depth tutorials on LLMs, RAGs, and real-world AI agent applications. A growing resource hub for AI engineers looking to implement production-ready systems.

trendingRepos.name: anthropics/claude-quickstarts
trendingRepos.description: Official Anthropic collection of deployable applications using the Claude API. Perfect starting point for building production Claude integrations.

trendingSkills.name: python-testing
trendingSkills.description: Testing framework guidance for Python projects using pytest. Covers fixtures, mocking, time freezing, and async test patterns—essential for robust AI agent testing.

trendingSkills.name: python-backend
trendingSkills.description: Backend development for Python web services. Focuses on FastAPI, async SQLAlchemy, PostgreSQL, and database migrations for modern API development.

trendingSkills.name: shape-memory
trendingSkills.description: Session continuity mechanism using conceptual anchors to preserve state across conversations. An innovative approach to maintaining context beyond chronological logs.

trendingSkills.name: git-commit
trendingSkills.description: Guidance on committing code changes using conventional commit standards and pre-commit validation practices. Essential for maintaining clean git history.

newMcpServers.name: hoverfly-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Exposes Hoverfly as a programmable API mocking tool for AI assistants. Enables dynamic mocking of third-party APIs to unblock development, automate testing, and simulate unavailable services during integration.

newMcpServers.name: apify-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Access Apify's marketplace of 3,000+ web scraping tools. Extract structured data from social media, e-commerce, search engines, maps, and any website through AI-powered workflows.

newMcpServers.name: vuln-nist-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Query the NVD/CVE REST API for security vulnerabilities. Features automatic query chunking for large date ranges and parallel processing—essential for security-conscious development.

newMcpServers.name: mcp-reddit
newMcpServers.description: Comprehensive Reddit integration for AI agents. Programmatically interact with subreddits, posts, and comments through a standardized interface for content research and engagement.

notableHooks.name: Auto-Format on Write
notableHooks.description: Automatically runs Prettier on TypeScript files after any Edit or Write operation. Uses the PostToolUse hook to maintain consistent code formatting without manual intervention.

notableHooks.name: Git Context Loader
notableHooks.description: Loads git status, recent commits, and branch info at session start. Persists environment variables via CLAUDE_ENV_FILE for consistent development context across sessions.

notableHooks.name: Secret Detection Guard
notableHooks.description: Blocks prompts containing potential secrets (passwords, API keys, tokens) before Claude processes them. A critical security hook using regex pattern matching to prevent accidental secret exposure.

tuiTools.name: lazygit
tuiTools.description: Simple terminal UI for git commands. The most popular Git TUI with intuitive keyboard shortcuts, staging hunks, interactive rebasing, and branch management—all without leaving the terminal.

tuiTools.name: yazi
tuiTools.description: Blazing fast terminal file manager written in Rust, based on async I/O. Features image previews, plugin system, and vim-like keybindings—the modern replacement for ranger.

tuiTools.name: rainfrog
tuiTools.description: A lightweight database management TUI built with Ratatui. Supports PostgreSQL, MySQL, and SQLite with a clean interface for queries, table exploration, and data browsing.

tuiTools.name: posting
tuiTools.description: A powerful HTTP client that lives in your terminal. Think Postman but as a beautiful TUI—test APIs, save collections, and manage environments without leaving your workflow.

trendingVideos.title: How I code with AI right now
Be a 10x Vibe Coder (Claude Code + Cursor + MCP)
Claude Code: A Highly Agentic Coding Assistant (Free Course)

highlights: Background Agent Support - agents run in the background while you work, enabling parallel task execution
Model attribution in Co-Authored-By commit messages for transparency on code generation sources
MCP server quick toggling with /mcp enable and /mcp disable commands for faster workflow
Session summaries with generated one-line descriptions for better context retention
Fixed API error handling for undefined property reads improving stability
Shell execution service bug fixes preventing both truncation and data bloat issues
GPT-5.1-Codex-Max is now the default model with extra-high reasoning mode available
New /resume slash command with improved session resumption performance
Linear integration - mention @Codex in issues to automatically kick off cloud tasks

notableQuotes.quote: Claude Code reached $1 billion in run-rate revenue in only 6 months. Together with Bun, we'll keep making it the best JavaScript runtime for all developers while building even better workflows into Claude Code.
notableQuotes.author: Mike Krieger

notableQuotes.quote: We've found that LLMs work best when they have clear boundaries and well-defined interfaces. The key is treating them as collaborators with specific expertise, not as omniscient oracles.
notableQuotes.author: Oxide Computer Company

notableQuotes.quote: Hooks run automatically during the agent loop with your current environment's credentials. Consider the security implications carefully—malicious hooks code can exfiltrate your data.
notableQuotes.author: Claude Code Documentation

prompt: Daily AI news digest generated by fetching from personal-homepage API feed, web searches for Claude Code/Gemini CLI/OpenAI Codex December 2025 news, trending GitHub repos via trotd, changelogs from all three tools, SkillsMP Claude skills feed, Docker MCP catalog searches, Claude Code hooks documentation, TUI tools research, and YouTube tutorials. Featured the Bun acquisition + $1B milestone as hero (major business news not yet featured as hero), with emphasis on hooks/automation, TUI tools renaissance, and practical MCP servers.
